str2: A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Joppa, a coast town of Judea, west-north-west of Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Joppe, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To send for, summon. From meta and pempo; to send from elsewhere, i.e. to summon or invite.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
